channel.title: musings on notes
channel.description: Recent content in musings on notes

item.title: Notes: 2nd Dec - 8th Dec
item.description: TL, DR; Work: Spies, branches and an incident. Life: Housemates, algorithms and kindness. Work things: Final week of compliance work (hopefully). Using Mockito Spies at work to help partially mock methods on a class. Branch based vs Trunk based development. I want to dedicate a bit more space for this discussion, but I wanted to highlight the difficulty of chasing someone down to review changes. We primarily work in a trunk-based manner (which I thoroughly enjoy) but for this particulary story I have been working on, the team decided to go with a branch based style and to have one developer working on the story.

item.title: Notes: 25th Nov - 1st Dec
item.description: TL, DR; Work things: The Future of CyberSecurity conference → I’ll write up a quick overview of the conference when I get time. Watched Mastering Chaos - A Netflix Guide to Microservices Played around with Cloudcraft Held an event at work involving high school students and the Mayor’s Fund for London Decommissioned an application that is no longer used. It’s super satisfying deleting code. Discussed the best practice for acccessing data from a database.

item.title: Notes: 17th Nov - 24th Nov
item.description: TL, DR; Work things: Finished a feature that adds specific information at the point of object creation, rather than enriching the object later on in the pipeline. Sprint planning → we are looking at splitting a monolithic application across two teams. Server response times in US were super slow → Caching the slow to build data solved this. Continued AWS learning → EC2, security groups and Elastic Block Storage (EBS).

item.title: Notes: 3rd Nov - 16th Nov
item.description: TL, DR; This article will cover a fortnights’ worth of musings (nothing about work, all about my holiday). Australia is pretty darn great. Discovered some new fun places in Sydney → White Rabbit Gallery and Sappho Books. Channeled Thelma & Louise and drove the Great Ocean Road with a friend. Detoured from the Great Ocean Road and did a few hikes in the Grampians. Hikes included Mt Abrupt - Mud Dadjug, Lake Elizabeth and Griffiths Island.

item.title: Notes: 27th Oct - 2nd Nov
item.description: TL, DR; Work things: AWS Solutions Architect Certification study continues → databases are my weakness Encryption at rest: Research into encrypting data in S3 buckets and ran into the issues with preserving the ‘last modified date’ metadata when running aws s3 cp s3://encrypted-bucket s3://encrypted-bucket --recursive --sse (any insight into this would be greatly appreciated). Completed stories to protect our application from XSS (reflected and stored).

item.title: Not another blog
item.description:
What is this? A blog. Yes another blog. It’s a place that I do not expect many people to deliberately seek out, stumble upon sure but not stay for long. The reason for this blog is a purely selfish one. This is a place to keep my musings and an easy way to direct people (mainly myself) to information.
What can you expect? To be perfectly honest - fairly irregular blog posts.
